column4: I'm trying to install Ubuntu onto my new laptop via a flash drive and UNetBootin, but when I pick any of the three options in the boot menu, it just cuts to a blank screen!  Any tips?
how long does the blank screen stay?
Until I shut off the screen.
*shut off the laptop
did you try some safe boot option?
Yes.  Still nothing.
do you have caps lock led on your keyboard? Does pressing chasnge it? How long does disk keep working after it shuts down the screen? did you try an external screen?
No Caps Lock, pressing keys does nothing, I don't know how I can tell, and no I have not but I don't see how that would be the issue.
then numlock
Well, I mean I have the keys, but they're not active.
there might be a disk led on the usb drive
There is.  It flashes for a bit, then just glows flatly.
then ubuntu is probably incompatible with your hardware. You can try different version
it flashes after the screen goes blank?
Yes.
Just once.
And by "blank" I mean "black"; the screen itself is still on.
then graphics driver probably crashes the machine. Should not happen in the "safe" mode but whatever
What should I do, then?
still it might be some other driver that happens to load at the time but since Ubuntu helpfully turns off the screen you never know
try other version/distro
or make it not blank the screen and take a picture of the messages
